meanings.definition: A hard, wear-resistant alloy used in cutting tools and other applications.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used a stellite blade to cut through the tough metal.
meanings.sent2: The stellite coating on the drill bit helped it last longer.
meanings.sent3: The stellite alloy was so tough, it could probably cut through a diamond!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like stellite, cutting through any obstacles in her way.
meanings.sent5: The stellite material gleamed in the sunlight, showcasing its durability.

meanings.definition: To coat or overlay with stellite.
meanings.sent1: The workers will stellite the metal parts to protect them from corrosion.
meanings.sent2: He decided to stellite the blade to make it more durable.
meanings.sent3: She playfully suggested they stellite the entire car for a futuristic look.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to stellite her heart, making it impenetrable to further hurt.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush seemed to stellite the canvas, adding a magical sheen to the painting.
